skill.name: bioservices
skill.description: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt, KEGG, ChEMBL, PubChem, Reactome, QuickGO. Unified API for queries, ID mapping, pathway analysis. For direct REST control, use individual database skills (uniprot-database, kegg-database).
skill.summary: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes executable Python scripts that call external bioinformatics services and write local output files. No credential access, environment harvesting, or external command execution is present. Risk is limited to network requests and user-directed filesystem writes.

content.value_statement: You need to combine protein, pathway, and compound data across services. This skill provides ready Python workflows that unify those queries.
actual_capabilities: Search UniProt and retrieve FASTA sequences
Run BLASTP similarity searches with NCBIblast
Map identifiers in batches using UniProt mapping
Analyze KEGG pathways and export CSV and SIF outputs
Query PSICQUIC interaction databases for proteins
Cross reference compounds across KEGG, ChEBI, and ChEMBL
limitations: Requires network access to external bioinformatics services
BLAST requires a valid email address and can take minutes
Scripts depend on the bioservices Python package being installed
Pathway analysis can be slow without using the limit option

use_cases.title: Protein analysis run
use_cases.description: Retrieve a protein sequence, run BLAST, and list related pathways in one workflow.

use_cases.title: Compound ID mapping
use_cases.description: Map KEGG compounds to ChEBI and ChEMBL identifiers for downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Teaching pipeline demo
use_cases.description: Demonstrate multi database queries using UniProt, KEGG, and GO.

prompt_templates.title: Simple ID mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Map UniProt ID P43403 to KEGG and list the KEGG IDs.

prompt_templates.title: Compound lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the KEGG ID for Geldanamycin and map it to ChEBI and ChEMBL.

prompt_templates.title: Pathway export
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze KEGG pathways for hsa and save summary files to ./output.

prompt_templates.title: Full protein workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the protein analysis workflow for ZAP70_HUMAN using my email and skip BLAST.

output_examples.input: Analyze KEGG pathways for hsa and summarize the outputs.
output: Total pathways analyzed and total interactions

best_practices: Use standard organism codes like hsa and mmu
Provide a valid email address when running BLAST
Write outputs to a dedicated directory per run
anti_patterns: Do not run large organism analyses without a limit during testing
Do not assume every ID maps to a target database
Do not run workflows without network access

faq.question: Is it compatible with Python 3.11?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill states support for Python 3.9 through 3.12.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: Limits are set by each external service and can change over time.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the scripts are standalone and the API can be used directly in Python.

faq.question: Does it access my credentials or private files?
faq.answer: No, it only reads input files you provide and writes outputs you request.

faq.question: What if a service fails or times out?
faq.answer: Retry the request, increase timeouts, or use smaller batches and limits.

faq.question: How does it compare to direct REST calls?
faq.answer: It offers a unified API and scripts, while direct REST offers finer control.
